properties.Name: ExperianCompanyMonthlyPaymentTrend
properties.Description: Days Beyond Terms (DBT) is a dollar-weighted calculation of the average number of days that payment was made beyond the invoice due date based on trades on file that have been updated in the previous three months.

Columns.Name: ExperianFileNumber
Columns.Description: The unique and persistent number that identifies and tracks the Experian company.

Columns.Name: ProfileTimestamp
Columns.Description: The timestamp of the Experian profile.

Columns.Name: DateReported
Columns.Description: The date the information is 'as-of' or reported.

Columns.Name: IndustryDbtNumber
Columns.Description: The average number of days (past terms) an industry takes to pay its suppliers.

Columns.Name: CompanyDbtNumber
Columns.Description: The average number of days (past terms) a business takes to pay its suppliers.

Columns.Name: BalanceAmount
Columns.Description: The outstanding balance amount on all DBTs.

Columns.Name: 130DbtPercentage
Columns.Description:
The percentage of companies paying 1-30 Days Beyond Terms (DBT).

Days Beyond Terms (DBT) is the average number of days a firm pays its bills past the invoice due date.

Columns.Name: 3160DbtPercentage
Columns.Description:
The percentage of companies paying 31-60 Days Beyond Terms (DBT).

Days Beyond Terms (DBT) is the average number of days a firm pays its bills past the invoice due date.

Columns.Name: 6190DbtPercentage
Columns.Description:
The percentage of companies paying 61-90 Days Beyond Terms (DBT).

Days Beyond Terms (DBT) is the average number of days a firm pays its bills past the invoice due date.

Columns.Name: 91PlusDbtPercentage
Columns.Description:
The percentage of companies paying 91+ Days Beyond Terms (DBT).

Days Beyond Terms (DBT) is the average number of days a firm pays its bills past the invoice due date.
